description:
Extract domain-annotated regions

Takes a genbank file which has been annotated using the domainator program, looks for the specified domains, and extracts them from the contigs.

This tool is typically used with protein sequences, but can also be used with nucleic acid sequences.
Handling of nucleic acids is less stable and will may change in future updates, so use with caution.

can write a fasta or a genbank file

parameters.name: Input
parameters.help: Genbank filenames. If not supplied, reads from stdin.

parameters.name: Output
parameters.help: the name of the output file. If not supplied, writes to stdout.

parameters.name: Contigs
parameters.help: only extract domains from contigs with ids in this list. Additive with --contigs_file. default: all contigs.

parameters.name: Contigs File
parameters.help: only extract domains from contigs with ids listed in this file (one per line). Additive with --contigs. default: all contigs.

parameters.name: Evalue
parameters.help: the evalue cutoff (max) for domain annotations to be extracted

parameters.name: Score
parameters.help: the score cutoff (min) for domain annotations to be extracted

parameters.name: Domains File
parameters.help: text file containing names of domains to include.

parameters.name: Databases
parameters.help: Domain databases to use for domain extraction. default: all databases.

parameters.name: Search Hits
parameters.help: Select domains that are marked as search hits (from domain_search.py).

parameters.name: Pad Up
parameters.help: extract this many additional residues (or bases) upstream of the hit region.

parameters.name: Pad Down
parameters.help: extract this many additional residues (or bases) downstream of the hit region.

parameters.name: Combine
parameters.help: if set, then when multiple target domains occur in the same contig, an envelope containing all of the hit domains will be extracted. By default, each hit domain will be extracted separately. This option will raise an exception on circular contigs, because it would be ambiguous.

parameters.name: Keep Direction
parameters.help: by default extracted regions will be flipped so that the domain (or the domain with the lowest start coordinate when --combine is active) is on the forward strand. Set this option to not reverse complement anything. In the rare case of a split domain with parts on different strands, the strand of the first part will be considered.

parameters.name: Keep Name
parameters.help: by default, extracted regions will be renamed to note their original coordinates and whether they were reverse complemented. Set this option to keep contigs with their original names. WARNING: if you aren't careful, this can easily result in duplicate names.

parameters.name: Fasta Out
parameters.help: makes output a fasta file when activated
